title: La Gazette de café du cycliste

elements.title: AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook Outdoors is out there. Before and after the bike, between and among the hills. New Arrière-Pays pieces for AW21 inspired by the back country around Nice.

elements.title: Badlands: The Ultra Distance Gravel Race.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Badlands: The Ultra Distance Gravel Race. Sophie Gateau tackles Badlands, an unsupported off-road race through Andalusia, made up of around 725km and 15,000m of altitude gain.

elements.title: Ride of the Month: October.
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: October. In October 2020, Storm Alex hit the valleys in the hinterland around Nice and the whole landscape was permanently altered. Chris returns one year later.

elements.title: Tracks and Trails in the Ariège.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Tracks and Trails in the Ariège. Five friends explore routes shared with the incredibly diverse range of four legged and airborne residents of the Ariège by bike.

elements.title: Guillaume Néry: A Traverse Across the Pyrenees
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Guillaume Néry: A Traverse Across the Pyrenees Each summer, I set off on an adventurous trip with good friends who are up for a challenge. Last year, we bikepacked through the Alps and this year we tackled the Pyrenees.

elements.title: Roc d'Azur: The CDC Gravel Team.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Roc d'Azur: The CDC Gravel Team. At Café du Cycliste we really like gravel and so we have formed the ‘True Grit’ Café du Cycliste team. Three fierce female riders, Holly, Charlotte and Maria, take on one of the greatest gravel events in the world.

elements.title: I am not number 06.
elements.contents:
FILMS

I am not number 06. Alexia is the 10th woman in the world among nearly 100 skippers to have finished the Vendée Globe race without stopping and without assistance. Cycling is her other passion.

elements.title: The Best Tortilla in the World
elements.contents:
LA VIE

The Best Tortilla in the World is found at the end of a hard day spent riding with friends on ancient Galician roads.

elements.title: Café du Cycliste x 66°North Lookbook
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

Café du Cycliste x 66°North Lookbook Café du Cycliste has joined forces with one of Iceland’s oldest manufacturing companies, 66°North to present a special collection of technical gear.

elements.title: Café du Cycliste x 66°North
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

Café du Cycliste x 66°North A collaboration of brands to create cycling apparel designed for Iceland, allowing cyclists to tackle the winter weather anywhere in the world.

elements.title: Caravan
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Caravan A collective of like minded sports people bonded by a shared love of cycling. Their reasons for riding are varied but they all have a common passion for exploring on two wheels.

elements.title: Rindu Alam Puncak: a Ride in Indonesia.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Rindu Alam Puncak: a Ride in Indonesia. Grace Adoe rides up to Puncak, one of two iconic cycling routes in Jakarta, climbing over 1,000m through traditional markets and tea plantations for some poffertjes at Rindu Alam.
